#Text=2. Mathematical Model of the CSC System
#Text=Schematic of the CSC system for the aircraft DC MG is shown in
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=.
#Text=Power source connected to the input side of CSC could be the variable frequency main generators or the auxiliary power units .
#Text=The input LC filter constituted by the inductor L fi and the capacitor C fi attenuates high-frequency harmonics in input currents of CSC .
#Text=In practice , part or all of the filter inductance can be provided by the armature inductance of generators .
#Text=CSC consists of six switches with reverse blocking capability .
#Text=If bidirectional power flow is required , each switch can be composed of two transistors in common-source connection .
#Text=Otherwise , one transistor and one diode in series could serve as each switch if unidirectional power flow is sufficient .
#Text=One freewheeling diode can be installed at the output side of CSC to reduce the conduction loss , yet negative output voltage will be unavailable .
#Text=An LC filter composed of the inductor L fo and capacitor C fo is installed at the output of CSC to provide smooth load voltage .
#Text=According to
#Text=Figure 2

#Text=, continuous model of the input circuit of CSC can be expressed in the state-space form : ( 1 ) where u s and i s are the vectors representing source voltages and currents respectively ; u i and i i are the vectors representing input voltages and currents of CSC respectively and matrices A i and B i are expressed as : ( 2 ) where R fi is the parasitic resistance of the filter inductor L fi .

#Text=For simplifying the derivation of prediction models for the output DBPC , differential equations rather than the state-space equation are adopted to model the output circuit : ( 3 ) ( 4 ) where u o and i o are the output voltage and current of CSC respectively ; u L and i L are the load voltage and current respectively and R fo is the parasitic resistance of the inductor L fo .

#Text=By controlling switches of CSC , appropriate input current vector i i and output voltage u o can be generated to obtain desired source current vector i s , output current i o and load voltage u L.
#Text=According to the principle of CSC , there are nine valid switching states in total , as listed in Table 1 .
#Text=The first six states generate active i i and non-zero u o.
#Text=In Table 1 , uxy denotes the input line – line voltage between phase x and phase y , where x , y ∈ { A , B , C } .
#Text=The last three states generate zero i i and u o. If a freewheeling diode is adopted , these zero states can be replaced by the on-state of the freewheeling diode .
